input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Lists users authorized to access the management server. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <all/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. all[Required] Indicates that all user details are required.
2. Provides information about the specified user. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required.
3. Provides information about the specified user's role. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> <role/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required. role[Required] Indicates that role information for the specified user is required.
4. Provides information about the specified user's organizations. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> <organization/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required. organization[Required] Indicates that organization information for the specified user is required.
5. Provides a detailed description of the users authorized to access the management server. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <all/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. all[Required] Indicates that all user details are required.
6. Provides a detailed description about the specified user. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required.
7. Provides a detailed description about the specified user's role. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> <role/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required. role[Required] Indicates that role information for the specified user is required.
8. Provides a detailed description about the specified user's organizations. Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>show</command> <category>security</category> <process-id>find-user-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <user> <user-id>1001</user-id> <organization/> </user> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. user[Required] Indicates that user details are required. user-id[Required] id of the user whose details are required. organization[Required] Indicates that organization information for the specified user is required.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Lists users authorized to access the management server. 2. Provides information about the specified user. 3. Provides information about the specified user's role. 4. Provides information about the specified user's organizations. 5. Provides a detailed description about the users authorized to access the management server. 6. Provides a detailed description of the specified user. 7. Provides a detailed description of the specified user's role. 8. Provides a detailed description of the specified user's organizations.
